newsitem.title: USA: Nebraska feedlot cattle market quiet,no sales-USDA.
newsitem.headline: Nebraska feedlot cattle market quiet,no sales-USDA.

text.p: Trading on slaughter steers and heifers was at a typical Monday standstill, USDA said.

Buyer inquiry was fair; seller interest light. Packer bids $108.00- $109.00 per cwt on a dressed basis, with asking prices $111.00-$112.00. Last established market Friday at $110.00. Live basis sales - Equivalent 3 percent shrink delivered and FOB, some FOB 4% shrink. Dressed basis delivered ( paid on hot carcass weights)
Slaughter heifers - No reported sales. Confirmed - None Last Week - None Last Year - 1,100 For week - 3,800 Sm Pd Lst Wk- 4,500 Sm Pd Lst Yr- 1,400
